Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. This is `line_1` in `loop_1`. 2. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.1875]. This is `line_2` in `loop_1`. 3. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.1875] to point [0.1438, 0.1875]. This is `line_3` in `loop_1`. 4. Draw a line from point [0.1438, 0.1875] to point [0.1438, 0.5]. This is `line_4` in `loop_1`. 5. Draw a line from point [0.1438, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.5]. This is `line_5` in `loop_1`. 6. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.0] to close the loop. This is `line_6` in `loop_1`. This part consists of a single face (`face_1`), which contains a single loop (`loop_1`), and six lines (`line_1` to `line_6`). After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the `sketch_scale` parameter of 0.75. Then transform the scaled sketch into a 3D sketch using the provided euler angles and translation vector in the coordinate system. Next, extrude the 2D sketch by 0.375 units along the normal direction to create the 3D model of this part. This will result in a sloped rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.375 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
